channel.title: Moving on with Blender [Platebody]
channel.description:
Tried to make a Platebody. Didn't turn out as well as i thought it would. Ah well, I'm still learning :<===========>
Top [img]http://img96.imageshack.us/img96/9302/plate1o.png[/img] Diagonal-View [img]http://img341.imageshack.us/img341/5830/plate3.png[/img] Wireframe [img]http://img338.imageshack.us/img338/305/plate4.png[/img]
Yeah, i know, i did some serious poly-overkill on the side

item.title: Moving on with Blender [Platebody]
item.dc:creator: @zachrida zachrida
item.description:
@zachrida wrote:

you should round the sides that will make it alot better!

Read full topic

item.title: Moving on with Blender [Platebody]
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:9, topic:345893”][quote author=dylan_0789 link=topic=442272.msg3251246#msg3251246 date=1277772495]

Just a suggestion, extrude the arms from the polygons from the main body, not create whole new primitives for the arms/shoulders.

P.s. poly overkill. :o

For a plate body you want the arms and shoulder pads separate… how can you manouver in armor if the shoulder pads cant move? Also, for RS animating you want the arms and shoulders separate.
[/quote]
But thats runescape getting too careless for realism. Realistically there is a different plate for the shoulders, upper arm, and forearm. How can you move in armor that offers no movement? Runescape is becoming more and more stupid (personal opinion).
Ah, I guess I was thinking more character modelling in general rather than armour.
Although, the new platebody models since HD in Runescape are all one model? Arms and body not separate.[/quote][quote=“Java Is My Bitch, post:8, topic:345893”]however, if you want the model’s polyflow to impress someone I think CJ’s comment would definatly help, besides the arms and stuff don’t really need to be separate, you just need to add the t-skins & w/e the other skins are.[/quote]
I’m talking about realism. Realistically speaking they would have to be separate.

Read full topic

item.title: Moving on with Blender [Platebody]
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:7, topic:345893”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=442272.msg3248423#msg3248423 date=1277563712]
Just a suggestion, extrude the arms from the polygons from the main body, not create whole new primitives for the arms/shoulders.

P.s. poly overkill. :o
[/quote]
For a plate body you want the arms and shoulder pads separate… how can you manouver in armor if the shoulder pads cant move? Also, for RS animating you want the arms and shoulders separate.[/quote]

Ah, I guess I was thinking more character modelling in general rather than armour.
Although, the new platebody models since HD in Runescape are all one model? Arms and body not separate.

Read full topic

item.title: Moving on with Blender [Platebody]
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

however, if you want the model’s polyflow to impress someone I think CJ’s comment would definatly help, besides the arms and stuff don’t really need to be separate, you just need to add the t-skins & w/e the other skins are.

Read full topic

item.title: Moving on with Blender [Platebody]
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:3, topic:345893”]Just a suggestion, extrude the arms from the polygons from the main body, not create whole new primitives for the arms/shoulders.

P.s. poly overkill. :o[/quote]
For a plate body you want the arms and shoulder pads separate… how can you manouver in armor if the shoulder pads cant move? Also, for RS animating you want the arms and shoulders separate.

Read full topic

item.title: Moving on with Blender [Platebody]
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

jake cake:

Nice, I hate blender it’s too confusing… I use metasequoia :]

Thats why I initially didn’t use blender. People will tell you, “Yes, is has a confusing GUI, but that just takes getting used to”, and that is right, its only how the GUI is setup that confuses people and turns them away. You do need a mouse to use it though (from what I hear, haven’t gotten around to looking at it much).

@TOPIC - Nice job, I do recommend trying out JIMB’s idea, seems logical to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Moving on with Blender [Platebody]
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

Retarded fatman armor!
Not horrible, just add more detail, and most importantly look at a reference, now when i say that; I don’t mean steal other people’s designs, I recommend you draw concept art or use the human anatomy to check if it would work out on a human.

Read full topic
